item.title: Interesting things I saw this week - 27
item.description: Last week I was reading The Theory of the Leisure Class by Thorstein Veblen, in this book the author exposes the history and motivations behind what is called the leisure class, i.e. “the upper classes […] exempt or excluded from industrial occupations, […] reserved for certain employments to which a degree of honour attaches.” Through the second chapter, Pecuniary Emulation, the author explains how money and material possessions came to be a symbol of status and admiration in today’s society.
